translation:
Most Illustrious Sir

Having D. Antônio Casas delivered, according to the Government's order, to the collector Vasco Amaro the amount of five thousand nine hundred and forty-five pesos, thus exceeding by 945 pesos the five thousand that Your Lordship Casas on the second of last November, it is necessary that Your Lordship nine hundred and forty-five pesos, having the competent receipt for its discharge and to have it accounted for in the Treasury.

God keep Your Lordship
Piratini, December 15, 1838.
Bento Gonçalves da Silva

Most Illustrious Sir Joaquim Pereira Fagundes
Commander of Police of Begé.
Bagé, January 30, 1839.

I received from Mr. Antônio Casas.
It is in order.
Joaquim Pereira Fagundes
It is in order.
The major officer and secretary.
Antônio Belarmino Ribeiro
